required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Pharmacokinetics (PK) Study to Investigate the Effect of Rifampin on PK of Vemurafenib (Zelboraf)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I, Open-Label, Multicenter, Three-Period, One-Sequence Study to Investigate the Effect of Rifampin on the Pharmacokinetics of a Single Oral Dose of 960 mg of Vemurafenib

brief_summary.textblock: This open-label, multi-center, three-period, one-sequence study will investigate the effect of rifampin on the PK of vemurafenib in participants with unresectable BRAFV600-mutation positive metastatic melanoma or other malignant tumor type that harbors a V600-activating mutation of BRAF without acceptable standard treatment options. Eligible participants will have the option to continue treatment with vemurafenib as part of an extension study GO28399 (NCT01739764).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration Time Point (AUClast) of Vemurafenib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
primary_outcome.description: AUClast is the area under the vemurafenib plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero to the time of last measured concentration of vemurafenib (Tlast). Area under the curve (AUC) is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUClast is presented in micrograms times (*) hour per milliliter (mcg*h/mL).

primary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUC[0-inf]) of Vemurafenib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
primary_outcome.description: AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0-inf). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-inf) is presented in mcg*h/mL.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Vemurafenib
primary_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
primary_outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma vemurafenib concentration, presented in microgram per milliliter (mcg/mL).

other_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Cmax (Tmax) of Vemurafenib
other_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
other_outcome.description: Tmax is the time from vemurafenib administration to reach Cmax for vemurafenib.

other_outcome.measure: Plasma Elimination Half Life (t1/2) of Vemurafenib
other_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
other_outcome.description: Plasma elimination half-life is the time measured during drug elimination phase for the plasma drug concentration to decrease by one half.

other_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
other_outcome.description: Clearance of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is removed (metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes) from the blood. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed.

other_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to 168 Hours [AUC(0-168)] of Vemurafenib
other_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
other_outcome.description: AUC(0-168) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to 168 hours (time point for last blood sample collection). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-168) is presented in mcg*h/mL.

other_outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
other_outcome.description: The AUCpeo, that is, percent area obtained after extrapolation from Tlast to infinity is calculated by using the formula AUCpeo = 100*(AUC[0-inf] minus AUC[0-last])/AUC(0-inf). This parameter provides information about what percentage of the theoretical curve AUC(0-inf) is possible to determine experimentally (AUC0-last).

arm_group.description: There will be 3 intervention periods in the study: Period A (Days 1 to 7), Period B (Days 8 to 16), and Period C (Days 17 to 24). Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, will receive vemurafenib at a dose of 960 milligrams (mg) as film-coated tablets orally alone on Day 1 (Period A); with rifampin (at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally) on Day 17 (Period C); and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily will be administered from Days 8 through 16 (Period B) and from Days 18 through 23 (Period C).

intervention.description: Rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily will be administered from Days 8 through 23 (Periods B and C).
Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, will receive vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1 (Period A) and on Day 17 (Period C).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Participants with either unresectable Stage IIIc or Stage IV metastatic melanoma positive for the BRAF V600 mutation or other malignant tumor type that harbors a V600-activating mutation of BRAF, as determined by results of cobasÂ® 4800 BRAF V600 mutation test or a Deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) sequencing method, and who have no acceptable standard treatment options
- Eastern Cooperative Oncology Group (ECOG) performance status 0 to 2
- Life expectancy of greater than or equal to (>/=) 12 weeks
- Full recovery from the effects of any major surgery or significant traumatic injury within 14 days prior to the first dose of study treatment
- Adequate hematologic and end organ function
- Female participants of childbearing potential and male participants with partners of childbearing potential must agree to always use 2 effective methods of contraception
- Negative serum pregnancy test within 7 days prior to commencement of dosing in women of childbearing potential
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior treatment with vemurafenib or other BRAF inhibitor within 42 days of first dose of study drug
- Requirement for immediate or urgent treatment with daily vemurafenib and for whom the intermittent schedule of vemurafenib employed during the 24-day period for this trial is not clinically acceptable
- Allergy or hypersensitivity to components of the vemurafenib formulation
- Experimental therapy within 4 weeks prior to first dose of study drug
- Major surgical procedure or significant traumatic injury within 14 days prior to first dose of study drug, or anticipation of the need for major surgery during study treatment
- Prior anti-cancer therapy within 28 days before the first dose of study drug
- History of clinically significant cardiac or pulmonary dysfunction
- History of symptomatic congestive heart failure of any New York Heart Association class or serious cardiac arrhythmia requiring treatment
- History of myocardial infarction within 6 months prior to first dose of study drug
- Current dyspnea at rest, owing to complications of advanced malignancy or any requirement for supplemental oxygen to perform activities of daily living
- History of congenital long QT syndrome or corrected QT interval (QTc) greater than (>) 450 milliseconds
- Active central nervous system lesions
- Uncontrolled or poorly controlled diabetes
- Current severe, uncontrolled systemic disease

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: A total of 27 participants were enrolled into the study.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (All Periods)
group.description: There were 3 intervention periods in the study: Period A (Days 1 to 7), Period B (Days 8 to 16), and Period C (Days 17 to 24). Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib (Zelboraf) at a dose of 960 milligrams (mg) as film-coated tablets orally alone on Day 1 (Period A); with rifampin (at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally) on Day 17 (Period C); and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 8 through 16 (Period B) and from Days 18 through 23 (Period C).

baseline.population: The intent-to-treat (ITT) population included all participants who were enrolled in the study.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (All Periods)
group.description: There were 3 intervention periods in the study: Period A (Days 1 to 7), Period B (Days 8 to 16), and Period C (Days 17 to 24). Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally alone on Day 1 (Period A); with rifampin (at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally) on Day 17 (Period C); and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 8 through 16 (Period B) and from Days 18 through 23 (Period C).

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration Time Point (AUClast) of Vemurafenib
outcome.description: AUClast is the area under the vemurafenib plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero to the time of last measured concentration of vemurafenib (Tlast). Area under the curve (AUC) is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUClast is presented in micrograms times (*) hour per milliliter (mcg*h/mL).
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)
outcome.population: The pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter population included all participants who received both scheduled doses of vemurafenib and who provided adequate PK assessments to calculate important PK parameters.

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to the Last Measurable Concentration Time Point (AUClast) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: AUClast is the area under the vemurafenib plasma concentration versus time curve from time zero to the time of last measured concentration of vemurafenib (Tlast). Area under the curve (AUC) is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUClast is presented in micrograms times (*) hour per milliliter (mcg*h/mL).
measure.population: The pharmacokinetics (PK) parameter population included all participants who received both scheduled doses of vemurafenib and who provided adequate PK assessments to calculate important PK parameters.

analysis.groups_desc: Analysis of variance (ANOVA) was applied to the log-transformed PK parameters, and then back transformed to provide geometric mean ratio (Period C/Period A) and confidence intervals.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUC[0-inf]) of Vemurafenib
outcome.description: AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0-inf). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-inf) is presented in mcg*h/mL.
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to Extrapolated Infinite Time (AUC[0-inf]) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: AUC(0-inf) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to extrapolated infinite time (0-inf). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-inf) is presented in mcg*h/mL.

analysis.groups_desc: ANOVA was applied to the log-transformed PK parameters, and then back transformed to provide geometric mean ratio (Period C/Period A) and confidence intervals.

outcome.description: Cmax is the maximum observed plasma vemurafenib concentration, presented in microgram per milliliter (mcg/mL).

measure.title: Time to Reach Cmax (Tmax) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: Tmax is the time from vemurafenib administration to reach Cmax for vemurafenib.

outcome.description: Plasma elimination half-life is the time measured during drug elimination phase for the plasma drug concentration to decrease by one half.
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Plasma Elimination Half Life (t1/2) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: Plasma elimination half-life is the time measured during drug elimination phase for the plasma drug concentration to decrease by one half.

outcome.title: Plasma Apparent Clearance (CL/F) of Vemurafenib
outcome.description: Clearance of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is removed (metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes) from the blood. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed.
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Plasma Apparent Clearance (CL/F) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: Clearance of a drug is a measure of the rate at which a drug is removed (metabolized or eliminated by normal biological processes) from the blood. Clearance obtained after oral dose (apparent oral clearance) is influenced by the fraction of the dose absorbed.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to 168 Hours [AUC(0-168)] of Vemurafenib
outcome.description: AUC(0-168) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to 168 hours (time point for last blood sample collection). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-168) is presented in mcg*h/mL.
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration Time-curve From Zero to 168 Hours [AUC(0-168)] of Vemurafenib
measure.description: AUC(0-168) is the AUC from time zero (pre-dose) to 168 hours (time point for last blood sample collection). AUC is a measure of the plasma concentration of a drug over time. AUC(0-168) is presented in mcg*h/mL.

outcome.title: Percent Extrapolated AUC(0-inf) (AUCpeo) of Vemurafenib
outcome.description: The AUCpeo, that is, percent area obtained after extrapolation from Tlast to infinity is calculated by using the formula AUCpeo = 100*(AUC[0-inf] minus AUC[0-last])/AUC(0-inf). This parameter provides information about what percentage of the theoretical curve AUC(0-inf) is possible to determine experimentally (AUC0-last).
outcome.time_frame: Predose (0 hour), 1, 2, 4, 6, 8, 12, 24, 30-32, 48, 72, 96, 120, 168 hours post vemurafenib-dose on Day 1 (Period A) and Day 17 (Period C)

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally along with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

measure.title: Percent Extrapolated AUC(0-inf) (AUCpeo) of Vemurafenib
measure.description: The AUCpeo, that is, percent area obtained after extrapolation from Tlast to infinity is calculated by using the formula AUCpeo = 100*(AUC[0-inf] minus AUC[0-last])/AUC(0-inf). This parameter provides information about what percentage of the theoretical curve AUC(0-inf) is possible to determine experimentally (AUC0-last).

reported_events.time_frame: Day 1 up to 28 days after last dose of study drug (up to 51 days overall)
reported_events.desc: The safety analysis population included all participants who received at least 1 dose of vemurafenib.

group.title: Vemurafenib (Intervention Period A)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib alone at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally on Day 1.

group.title: Rifampin (Intervention Period B)
group.description: Participants received rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily from Days 8 through 16.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (Intervention Period C)
group.description: Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally with rifampin at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally on Day 17 and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 18 through 23.

group.title: Vemurafenib + Rifampin (All Periods)
group.description: There were 3 intervention periods in the study: Period A (Days 1 to 7), Period B (Days 8 to 16), and Period C (Days 17 to 24). Participants, after an overnight fast of at least 10 hours, received vemurafenib at a dose of 960 mg as film-coated tablets orally alone on Day 1 (Period A); with rifampin (at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally) on Day 17 (Period C); and rifampin alone at a dose of 600 mg as capsules orally once daily was administered from Days 8 through 16 (Period B) and from Days 18 through 23 (Period C).

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The Study being conducted under this Agreement is part of the Overall Study. Investigator is free to publish in reputable journals or to present at professional conferences the results of the Study, but only after the first publication or presentation that involves the Overall Study. The Sponsor may request that Confidential Information be deleted and/or the publication be postponed in order to protect the Sponsor's intellectual property rights.
